page.title: 08RUSKINGTON LEGENDS
page.content:
In the Moore's household there is a ghost which is reputed to be the spirit of Mr Moore's great great grandad. It is said to haunt the cellar at night.
In Dorrington Wood many years ago a boy is said to have hanged himself from a tree. No one seems to know why yet, legend has it that his ghost can be seen when the moon is full.
In Haverholme Park there is a ruined priory , close to which is a small bridge near an old barn. A strange tale is told locally of a ghost which catches animals whilst out haunting and hangs them by their legs from the bridge. By Iain Morrice - age 10
